result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph L Tice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

DE will comply with all programing recommended by DOC agent.

DE will provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge

Case settlement

Defendant Joseph L Tice in court with attorney Kat Mcclain.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CT63.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver or rights.  DE will enter a plea in 15CF144 and Ct 2 of 15CT63.  Ct 1 in 15CT63 will be DRI.  

15CF144-NC, court accepts, finds DE G.  Sentence withheld, one year probation, will comply with all DOC programming, CC, DNA sample/surcharge

15CT63-Ct 2, NC-G.   Withhold sentence, one year probation. DE will pay a fine of $1789.00, serve 45 days jail, 24 month revocation of DL.  

Court will accept the recommendations of the parties,  DE will start jail today. DE may have huber if employed
